channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 119-125 greenhaven drive flytipping, 1st November
item.description:
A individual has dumped tbeir household waste in a parking space as too lazy to put in their own bin or drive to the tip. Stuff has been blocking a space for over a month now. I cant load the pic but its in the far right parking space in the corner to the right.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenhaven Drive, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gully blocked road partially flooded, 1st November
item.description:
The gullies on Peckham rye junction with scylla road re all blocked with leaves and causing partial flooding on road surfaces. And further up Peckham rye all the gullies blocked with leaves
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham Rye, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 1st November
item.description:
Apart from the recycling, someone has brought clothes over from the Salvation Army and gone through it all on our street. I have tidied a lot up already..rubbish on our street is pretty bad at the moment - largely down to poor behaviour.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rowhill Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement and potholes, 1st November
item.description:
Hello all In addition to the leaves and trash which have not been collected for two weeks, the pavements and the following streets (Lowman Road, Dunford Road and Jackson Road) have not been maintained for a long time and it is becoming very dangerous for bikes given potholes and difficult to navigate with a wheelchair given the uneven pavements. Please could somebody look into this. Thanks Best
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-25, Lowman Road, Holloway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left on street, please can this be cleansed?, 1st November
item.description:
Rubbish left on street and broken glass nearby please can the street be cleansed? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Recreation Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Looks like a truck has dumped asphalt and blocked the garages, 1st November
item.description:
Happened sometime last night it’s the garages 1to 9 now blocking people from using their garage

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Johns Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dirty street with trash, 1st November
item.description:
Hello all The following streets have not been cleaned for two weeks as the same trash is accumulating and throughout is pretty dirty: Lowman Road, Dunford Road, Jackson Road. Please could you send somebody to clean up? There used to be a gentleman coming each week but we haven’t seen him in a while and the streets are getting out control with trash and litter everywhere on the floor on those three streets. Many thanks Best
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-25, Lowman Road, Holloway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big crack across road causing extremely load bangs when lorry’s go over sinking part of road. Bexley swerved repairing before and don’t want to use pothole money from government, 1st November
item.description:

item.title: Continued problem with bin, 1st November
item.description:
I report this bin at least once a week. It is left out on the street and quickly overflows as people flop. We have to sweep out the front of our shop several times a day to deal with the rubbish that blows down. It is unfair that this problem continues. Please remove this bin.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Grove Lane, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
